Sequence Information.Source: sequence truncation, reptile cathelicidin analog, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Peptide discovery: the first reported genome predicted cathelicidin.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence shows similarity (41.67%) toBMAP-27-(1-18)R: 23%, F=K: 18%, G: 14%. A longer form (29 residues) of cathelicidin with four additional residues at the C-terminus was subsequnetly reported from the same species (See AP2965). This long form is temporarily assigned as "natural" until the peptide is isolated.Activity: Active against Gram- E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 3 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 8 ug/ml), S. typhimurium ATCC 14028 (MIC 2 ug/ml), Gram+ S.aureus ATCC 29213 (MIC >128 ug/ml), B. cereus ATCC 10876 (MIC 32 ug/ml).In vitro toxicity: chicken RBC, 4% hemolysis at 64 ug/ml. concentration-dependent.
Literature Information.Author: Kim D, Soundrarajan N, Lee J, Cho HS, Choi M, Cha SY, Ahn B, Jeon H, Le MT, Song H, Kim JH, Park C.2017
Literature Information.Title: Genomewide Analysis of the Antimicrobial Peptides in Python bivittatus and Characterization of Cathelicidins with Potent Antimicrobial Activity and Low Cytotoxicity.
